Comments_List: A great introduction into corporate finance with an equal weighted focus on the math and the conceptual context
I learned the basics of finance. I learned about discounting cash flows, capital budgeting, and option valuation.
A lot of skills on corporate finance, especially understanding options.
Discounted cash flows, basic finance concepts, valuing firms, options, bonds, securities, ect

I learned a broad base of information regarding financial accounting, company valuation, and many types of investment vehicles.  Significant time was also spent covering modern models for investment porfolios and public equity pricing.
Money rates, stock evaluations, basic accounting questions, economic theory... A lot.
This course was taught very well. The material was very interesting.
The main strength is the amazing lectures by Michael and his overall teaching method.

Strengths: Pascutti is an awesome teacher and you learn a lot about the basic essentials for corporate finance. Also, during the summer there are much fewer students so you are able to learn better and ask questions easily.
Weaknesses: It moves pretty fast, especially at the end, and the quizzes are pretty hard.
I would have liked it to have gone on longer.
I would definitely recommend this course, if you are interested in finance.
Yes, it covers a great deal of information that is useful for a career in finance.
Yes. Very much so. Enjoyable lecture, very challenging PSETs and tests, and good content.
Yes I do recommend. I didn't really know anything about finance and markets but this class helped me understand financial news and could help if you want to go into banking.
I would recommend the course to another student.  Professor Pascutti was highly engaging and covered a ton of valuable information in a short period of time.
I would advise anyone to take this course. The Professor is wonderful, the class is interesting, the topics are incredibly useful.... There are too many reasons why one should take the course.
